definition: Hypertext Markup Language, base structure or page for a web app/site, a way to tag text files with relevant display information.
Cascading Style Sheet makes the web the prettiest, handles layout/format, the look, and feel.
Makes the web dynamic and interactive, a functional programming language.
A high-level interpreted programming language. It is a language which is also characterized as dynamic, weakly typed, prototype-based and multi-paradigm.
eXtensionable Markup Language, designed to store and transport data.
The structure of code that dictates overall syntax and order of your HTML, the building blocks of the World Wide Web, within HTML there are finite set of Tags.
Implementation of a Tag, where the rubber hits the road for HTML page creation, the further structure within a Tag, typically has an opening and closing tag might be self-closing.
Nested forms of additional information, used to amplify the tag or element to enhance the characteristics of its trait, metadata of an element.
An abstract data type that includes a group of key identifiers and a set of associated values, name-value pair, key-value pair, field–value pair or attribute–value pair.
A set of data that describes and gives information about other data, the story of data, details about data.
Document Object Model, defines the structure of a document (HTML) and the way it is accessed/manipulated.
A group of objects with similar purpose.
An object within a collection, a grouping of intended behavior.
A container that groups classes, functions, behavior and values to achieve a specific purpose, can be a file(s) or section in the overall application.
Field of view, overall or narrow picture, the encapsulation of work, { }.
The overarching umbrella, cocoon, the content boundaries.
Integrated Development Environment, combines several tools (text editor, code compiler, source control manager and code executor) into one work environment.
Provides text based access to the operating system.
Source Version Control, enables rollback to previous versions of code, allows for collaborative effort on the same code base, provides a platform to distribute repositories.
Distributed/Decentralized SVC.
Shopping, Information Gathering and Information Distribution.
A connection point, a redistribution point, and a communication endpoint.
An open sourced, cross-platform, JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside of a browser.
Live execution.
The grammar of a language, how you write things in a given language.
Performs a task, basis for behavior, an expression involving one or more variable that operate in a particular way to perform work.
Replaceable object that is used for a specific purpose, commonly used within a function, functions are also considered variables.
mutable variable, local scope, ask yourself, "Does this need to change?" if, Yes pick this.
immutable variable, local scope, ask yourself, "Does this need to change?" if, No pick this.
mutable variable, global scope, please avoid using.
A data type or simply type is a classification of data which tells the compiler or interpreter how the programmer intends to use the data.
Collection of characters, alphanumeric and special characters included, immutable.
A numeric value that allows for decimals in JavaScript.
True / False statement, expression or value.
Something that executes a specific list of functions/tasks/behaviors, when talking about the HTML tag, it allows you to import JavaScript files into your DOM.
A question with a limited number of outcomes used to direct the flow of the application.
The definition of your tasks and what will be executed, you express logic to a computer to receive output from that computer.
A system or set of principles underlying the arrangements of elements in a computer or electronic device so as to perform a specified task.
A dataset that contains other objects, stores elements at zero based index keys, [ ].
Hexidecimal value for alphanumeric, symbols and special characters, Ascii is a subset of Unicode.
A function that executes at the completion of another, typically nested in the completed function and provided to that parent function via a parameter
An asynchronous function with state (fulfilled, rejected, pending), .then() or .catch() to handle completion.
Exists at the base level of whatever you are referring to, Native JavaScript object/functions are inherent in JavaScript and can be used without needing to define them as they are defined Natively.
Frontend and Backend develop, top to bottom web page with all the bells and whistles, made up of a UI, API, and DB.
User Interface (Frontend), Displays Data, how users interact with the application, the look and feel.
Application Programming Interface (Backend), Accesses Data, bridge between the client and database, business logic is housed here, the brains of the application.
Database (Backend), Stores Data.
A frontend, JavaScript, component-driven Library built by Facebook.
